column2: Is That Your Final Answer?
column3: page=0 xpos=2 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest page-top headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Florence Reeder
column3: page=0 xpos=4 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: George Mason Univ./MITRE Corp.
column3: page=0 xpos=3 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest hanged-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: 1820 Dolley Madison Blvd.

column2: McLean VA 22102
column3: page=0 xpos=4 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space
page=0 xpos=4 ypos=1 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space above-double-space above-line-space

column2: freeder@mitre.org
column3: page=0 xpos=4 ypos=1 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space symbol-atmark headchar-lower column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: ABSTRACT
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent font-largest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: The purpose of this research is to test the efficacy of applying
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: automated evaluation techniques, originally devised for the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: evaluation of human language learners, to the output of machine
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: translation (MT) systems. We believe that these evaluation
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: techniques will provide information about both the human
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: language learning process, the translation process and the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: development of machine translation systems. This, the first
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: experiment in a series of experiments, looks at the intelligibility of
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: MT output. A language learning experiment showed that
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: assessors can differentiate native from non-native language essays
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in less than 100 words. Even more illuminating was the factors
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: on which the assessors made their decisions. We tested this to see
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: if similar criteria could be elicited from duplicating the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: experiment using machine translation output. Subjects were given
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a set of up to six extracts of translated newswire text. Some of the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: extracts were expert human translations, others were machine
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: translation outputs. The subjects were given three minutes per
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: extract to determine whether they believed the sample output to be
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: an expert human translation or a machine translation.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Additionally, they were asked to mark the word at which they
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: made this decision. The results of this experiment, along with a
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: preliminary analysis of the factors involved in the decision
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: making process will be presented here.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Keywords
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-keyword headchar-capital

column2: Machine translation, language learning, evaluation.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1. INTRODUCTION
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: Machine translation evaluation and language learner evaluation
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: have been associated for many years, for example [5, 7]. One
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: attractive aspect of language learner evaluation which
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: recommends it to machine translation evaluation is the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: expectation that the produced language is not perfect, well-formed
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: language. Language learner evaluation systems are geared
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: towards determining the specific kinds of errors that language
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: learners make. Additionally, language learner evaluation, more
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: than many MT evaluations, seeks to build models of language
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: acquisition which could parallel (but not correspond directly to)
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the development of MT systems. These models frequently are
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower column-bottom

column2: feature-based and may provide informative metrics for diagnostic
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: evaluation for system designers and users.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In a recent experiment along these lines, Jones and Rusk [2]
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: present a reasonable idea for measuring intelligibility, that of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: trying to score the English output of translation systems using a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: wide variety of metrics. In essence, they are looking at the degree
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to which a given output is English and comparing this to human-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: produced English. Their goal was to find a scoring function for
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the quality of English that can enable the learning of a good
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: translation grammar. Their method for accomplishing this is
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: through using existing natural language processing applications
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: on the translated data and using these to come up with a numeric
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: value indicating degree of “Englishness”. The measures they
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: utilized included syntactic indicators such as word n-grams,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: number of edges in the parse (both Collins and Apple Pie parser
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: were used), log probability of the parse, execution of the parse,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: overall score of the parse, etc. Semantic criteria were based
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: primarily on WordNet and incorporated the average minimum
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: hyponym path length, path found ratio, percent of words with
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sense in WordNet. Other semantic criteria utilized mutual
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: information measures.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Two problems can be found with their approach. The first is that
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: the data was drawn from dictionaries. Usage examples in
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: dictionaries, while they provide great information, are not
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: necessarily representative of typical language use. In fact, they
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tend to highlight unusual usage patterns or cases. Second, and
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: more relevant to our purposes, is that they were looking at the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: glass as half-full instead of half-empty. We believe that our
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: results will show that measuring intelligibility is not nearly as
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: useful as finding a lack of intelligibility. This is not new in MT
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: evaluation – as numerous approaches have been suggested to
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: identify translation errors, such as [1, 6]. In this instance,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: however, we are not counting errors to come up with a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: intelligibility score as much as finding out how quickly the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: intelligibility can be measured. Additionally, we are looking to a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: field where the essence of scoring is looking at error cases, that of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: language learning.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2. SIMPLE LANGUAGE LEARNING
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space itemization above-line-space

column2: EXPERIMENT
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: The basic part of scoring learner language (particularly second
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: language acquisition and English as a second language) consists
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of identifying likely errors and understanding the cause of them.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: From these, diagnostic models of language learning can be built
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: and used to effectively remediate learner errors, [3] provide an
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: excellent example of this. Furthermore, language learner testing
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: seeks to measure the student's ability to produce language which
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-lower

column2: is fluent (intelligible) and correct (adequate or informative).
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: These are the same criteria typically used to measure MT system
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: capability <sup>.1</sup>
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In looking at different second language acquisition (SLA) testing
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: paradigms, one experiment stands out as a useful starting point for
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: our purposes. One experiment in particular serves as the model
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for this investigation. In their test of language teachers, Meara
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and Babi [3] looked at assessors making a native speaker (L1) /
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: language learner (L2) distinction in written essays <sup>.2</sup> They showed
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the assessors essays one word at a time and counted the number of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: words it took to make the distinction.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: They found that assessors could accurately attribute L1 texts
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: 83.9% of the time and L2 texts 87.2% of the time for 180 texts
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: and 18 assessors. Additionally, they found that assessors could
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: make the L1/L2 distinction in less than 100 words. They also
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: learned that it took longer to confirm that an essay was a native
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: speaker’s than a language learner’s. It took, on average, 53.9
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: words to recognize an L1 text and only 36.7 words to accurately
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: distinguish an L2 text. While their purpose was to rate the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: language assessment process, the results are intriguing from an
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: MT perspective.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: They attribute the fact that L2 took less words to identify to the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: fact that L1 writing “can only be identified negatively by the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: absence of errors, or the absence of awkward writing.” While
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: they could not readily select features, lexical or syntactic, on
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: which evaluators consistently made their evaluation, they
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: hypothesize that there is a “tolerance threshold” for low quality
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: writing. In essence, once the pain threshold had been reached
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: through errors, missteps or inconsistencies, then the assessor
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: could confidently make the assessment. It is this finding that we
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: use to disagree with Jones and Rusk [2] basic premise. Instead of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: looking for what the MT system got right, it is more fruitful to
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: analyze what the MT system failed to capture, from an
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: intelligibility standpoint. This kind of diagnostic is more difficult,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: as we will discuss later.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We take this as the starting point for looking at assessing the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: intelligibility of MT output. The question to be answered is does
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: this apply to distinguishing between expert translation and MT
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: output? This paper reports on an experiment to answer this
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: question. We believe that human assessors key off of specific
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: error types and that an analysis of the results of the experiment
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: will enable us to do a program which automatically gets these.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>1</sup> The discussion of whether or not MT output should be compared
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-super

column2: to human translation output is grist for other papers and other
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent indented-line headchar-lower

column2: forums.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: <sup>2</sup> In their experiment, they were examining students learning
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-space headchar-super

column2: Spanish as a second language.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: 3. SHORT READING TEST
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent font-largest column-top itemization

column2: We started with publicly available data which was developed
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: during the 1994 DARPA Machine Translation Evaluations [8],
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: focusing on the Spanish language evaluation first. They may be
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: obtained at: http://ursula.georgetown.edu. <sup>3</sup> We selected the first
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 50 translations from each system and from the reference
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line numbered-heading1

column2: translation. We extracted the first portion of each translation
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (from 98 to 140 words as determined by sentence boundaries). In
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: addition, we removed headlines, as we felt these served as
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: distracters. Participants were recruited through the author’s
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: workplace, through the author’s neighborhood and a nearby
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: daycare center. Most were computer professionals and some were
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: familiar with MT development or use. Each subject was given a
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: set of six extracts – a mix of different machine and human
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: translations. The participants were told to read line by line until
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: they were able to make a distinction between the possible authors
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the text – a human translator or a machine translator. The first
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: twenty-five test subjects were given no information about the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: expertise of the human translator. The second twenty-five test
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: subjects were told that the human translator was an expert. They
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: were given up to three minutes per text, although they frequently
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: required much less time. Finally, they were asked to circle the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: word at which they made their distinction. Figure 1 shows a
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sample text.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: __Figure 1__
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column centered left-over right-over box hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space figure-area

column2: Figure 1: Sample Test Sheet
column3: page=1 xpos=6 ypos=8 right-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail string-figure headchar-capital above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4. RESULTS
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent font-largest hanged-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: Our first question is does this kind of test apply to distinguishing
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: between expert translation and MT output? The answer is yes.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Subjects were able to distinguish MT output from human
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: translations 88.4% of the time, overall. This determination is
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>3</sup> Data has since been moved to a new location.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-super tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: more straightforward for readers than the native/non-native
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-lower

column2: speaker distinction. There was a degree of variation on a per-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: system basis, as captured in Table 1. Additionally, as presented in
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Table 2, the number of words to determine that a text was human
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line string-table headchar-capital

column2: was nearly twice the closest system. <sup>4</sup>
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 1: Percentage correct for each system
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: __Table 1__
column3: page=2 xpos=1 ypos=1 left-column centered left-indent right-indent box indented-line shorter-tail table-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 2: Average Number of Words to Determine
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: __Table 2__
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent box indented-line shorter-tail table-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The second question is does this ability correlate with the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: intelligibility scores applied by human raters? One way to look at
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the answer to this is to view the fact that the more intelligible a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system output, the harder it is to distinguish from human output.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: So, systems which have lower scores for human judgment should
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: have higher intelligibility scores. Table 3 presents the scores with
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the fluency scores as judged by human assessors.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 3: Percentage Correct and Fluency Scores
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: __Table 3__
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column centered left-indent right-indent box indented-line shorter-tail table-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Indeed, the systems with the lowest fluency scores were most
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: easily attributed. The system with the best fluency score was also
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the one most confused. Individual articles in the test sample will
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: need to be evaluated statistically before a definite correlation can
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: be determined, but the results are encouraging.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>4</sup> For those texts where the participants failed to mark a specific
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-super

column2: spot, the length of the text was included in the average.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: The final question is are there characteristics of the MT output
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-capital

column2: which enable the decision to be made quickly? The initial results
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: lead us to believe that it is so. Not translated words (non proper
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: nouns) were generally immediate clues as to the fact that a system
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: produced the results. Other factors included: incorrect pronoun
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: translation; incorrect preposition translation; incorrect
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: punctuation. A more detailed breakdown of the selection criteria
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and the errors occurring before the selected word is currently in
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: process.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 5. ANALYSIS
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: An area for further analysis is that of the looking at the details of
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: the post-test interviews. These have consistently shown that the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: deciders utilized error spotting, although the types and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sensitivities of the errors differed from subject to subject. Some
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: errors were serious enough to make the choice obvious where
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: others had to occur more than once to push the decision above a
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: threshold. Extending this to a new language pair is also desirable
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: as a language more divergent than Spanish from English might
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: give different (and possibly even stronger) results. Finally, we are
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: working on constructing a program, using principles from
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Computer Assisted Language Learning (CALL) program design,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: which is aimed to duplicate the ability to assess human versus
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system texts.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 6. ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
